newsitem.title: SENEGAL: Taiwanese visit Senegal to discuss fishing.
newsitem.headline: Taiwanese visit Senegal to discuss fishing.

text.p: A delegation of Taiwanese experts arrived in Senegal on Friday for a five-day visit and talks on investment opportunities in the fishing industry, Senegalese officials said.
Fishing port director Aly Diouf told Reuters that Senegal was interested in Taiwanese fishing boats using Dakar as their home port on the West African coast.
Last November Senegal and the European Union failed to agree a deal on fishing rights in Senegalese waters.
The Taiwanese delegation would visit Gambia after Senegal, the officials said.

China and Taiwan, which it regards as a renegade province, have a history of vying for the loyalty of countries in Africa. Senegal and Gambia are among African nations that have opted for ties with Taiwan.
